rules

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • rules.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    Rule is a class used to represent two conditions that together determine whether a specific MethodMetrics object is constitutes some kind of Smell

    In order to achieve this we have at our disposal various enum types:

    • Rule.Operation
    • Rule.LogicOp
    • Rule.Smell

    The inner class Rule.SubRule is also used to represent Rules

    Each Rule contains two Rule.SubRule,

    Example SE (LOC_method > 50 E CYCLO_method >10) ENTÃO A regra identificou o code smell Long Method neste método SENÃO A regra indica que o code smell Long Method não está presente neste método.LOC_class

    See Also:
    MethodMetrics, Rule.SubRule, Metric, Rule.LogicOp, Rule.Operation, Rule.Smell, Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Rule.LogicOp
      LogicOp is an enum containing these values
      static class  Rule.Operation
      Operation is an enum used to categorize mathematical logical operations to compare two diferent integer values
      static class  Rule.Smell
      A Smell represents a kind of codeSmell,
      static class  Rule.SubRule
      A SubRule is a simple rule

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule(Metric metric1,
            Rule.Operation operation1,
            java.lang.Integer value1,
            Metric metric2,
            Rule.Operation operation2,
            java.lang.Integer value2,
            Rule.LogicOp logicoperation,
            Rule.Smell smell)

        Constructor for a Rule, internally creates two Rule.SubRule and stores them inside itself together with the Rule.LogicOp and a Rule.Smell

        Parameters:
        metric1 - Metric used to create the first Rule.SubRule
        operation1 - Rule.Operation used to create the first Rule.SubRule
        value1 - integer value used to create the first Rule.SubRule
        metric2 - Metric used to create the second Rule.SubRule
        operation2 - Rule.Operation used to create the second Rule.SubRule
        value2 - integer value used to create the second Rule.SubRule
        logicoperation - a Rule.LogicOp used to link the two inner Rule.SubRule
        smell - a Rule.Smell used to determine the codeSmell that the rule is

      • deserializedRule

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Rule> deserializedRule()
                                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        Method do get the current set of rules stored in rules/rulehistory.ser

        In case the file rulehistory.ser is not found, it's created and added an empty ArrayList of rules

        Returns:
        An ArrayList with a set of rules
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IO operation failed
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Class Rule doesn't exist

      • deleteRule

        public static void deleteRule(Rule r)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        A new ArrayList of Rule is created, the current rules are obtained from the deserializeRule method. All the rules from the current rule list are passed to the new ArrayList, unless the rule is equal to the rule we want to delete, in this case the for each loop skips it, finally the new ArrayList is serialized and it replaces the current set of rules.

        Parameters:
        r - Rule to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IO operation failed
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Class Rule doesn't exist.

      • deleteRule

        public static void deleteRule(Rule r,
                              java.lang.String filePath)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • changeRule

        public static void changeRule(Rule oldRule,
                              Rule newRule)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        A new ArrayList of Rule is created, the current rules are obtained from the deserializeRule method. All the rules from the current rule list are passed to the new ArrayList, unless the rule is equal to the rule we want to update, in this case that rule is swapped with the new Rule. finally the new ArrayList is serialized and it replaces the current set of rules.

        Parameters:
        oldRule - Rule to be changed
        newRule - Rule updated
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IO operation failed
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Class Rule doesn't exist.

      • doesRuleExist

        public static boolean doesRuleExist(Rule rule)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        The rule given enters a for each loop and is compared to all the rules in the rulehistory.ser file

        Parameters:
        rule - rule to be checked
        Returns:
        true if rule already exists and false if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IO operation failed
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Class Rule doesn't exist
